relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Greek Life
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
In three sentences
Comments
You have to have a key card to get onto housing buildings at any time. Campus police patrol during all hours. If you need an escort at night they will gladly come pick you up.
There is a Greek presence on campus.
All different kinds of clubs and activities to chose from and if your kind of club is not available, you are encouraged to start your own.
Students who like small, quiet environments to learn in.
The gathering place is a fun spot to hang out. We have a rock and the mall that get sainted or written for to share upcoming events
There is a movie theater, skating rink, boutiques, big chain stores just minutes away. There are hiking trails, parks you can visit.
Has places for health and not so healthy food. Four different dining places that serve good food.
Never very far from a classmate if you need help with work. Activities to bring everybody in the building together.

Certain classes will make you read a lot, others will challenge you to developed and defend ideas on a given topic. Some classes you will have to study constantly to keep up with others you will only have to read to be able to pass.

Community that strives to push everybody to be the best they can be. Friendly, small campus with tons of activities to get involved in. Challenging curriculum that will prepare you for whatever major you are in.
pageTitle: Marietta College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {136270=4 sororities and 4 fraternities with a campus population of around 1400 students., 151824=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 48301=Every year we have Doo Dah Day, which is a campus-wide stress-relief fun day before finals in April. The college and students arrange activities like ultimate frisbee tournaments, mud volleyball tournaments, other competitions and rent blow-up bouncers of all kinds. The foodservice is an outdoor barbecue and everyone has a great time all day. The Mall is the main vein of the college - it is a brick walkway that used to be the continuation of Fifth Street. The college finally reached an accordance with the town to lay down brick and close it off to motorized vehicles. It is always a good place to meet people and a good point at which to rendezvous., 23721=Small class sizes and a demanding load of general education credits makes Marietta a college where an absence of work can not go undetected. Additionally, Marietta was called the Harvard of the mid-west in the Princeton Review 2011.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck It's a little expensive but you get a lot here. Like free laundry! All events are free to students too. They offer students a lot. All campus is wi-fi. Am enjoying being here I love it here. The student body is so diverse that it is easy to find a friend and you never have to try to fit it. There are lots of events that the college hosts regularly. Am learning a lot The professors here are all really helpful, they all give you their office hours the first day if you need any extra help. Some even give you there cell phone numbers if you need help with homework. Marietta also has lots of tutoring programs to help for free. Login to rate or flag the reviews Ryan from Milford, OH 12/16/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 32
